text: Tatiana Yevgenyevna Samoilova (; 4 May 1934 â€“ 4 May 2014) was a Soviet and Russian movie actress. She starred in The Cranes Are Flying (1957), The Unsent Letter (1959) and Anna Karenina (1967). Samoilova's career began in 1955. She starred in over 50 Russian movies. She retired in 2008. Samoilova was born in Leningrad, Russia SFSR, Soviet Union. On 3 May 2014, the eve of her 80th birthday, Samoilova was taken to hospital in Moscow. She had a serious condition with coronary heart disease and hypertension. She died, two days later on 4 May 2014. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1934 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from coronary artery disease Category:Deaths from hypertension Category:Actors from Saint Petersburg Category:Russian movie actors Category:Soviet actors
title: Tatiana Samoilova
